intro: Geissois parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered geissois, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
